meanings.definition: The quality or state of being hygroscopic.
meanings.sent1: The hygroscopicities of the salt caused it to clump together in the humid weather.
meanings.sent2: The hygroscopicities of the sponge made it perfect for drying up spills.
meanings.sent3: The hygroscopicities of the paper made it feel like a wet towel.
meanings.sent4: The hygroscopicities of the plant's leaves were like tiny sponges soaking up the rain.
meanings.sent5: The hygroscopicities of the cotton candy made it melt quickly in the summer heat.

meanings.definition: The ability to absorb moisture from the air.
meanings.sent1: The hygroscopicities of the silica gel packets kept the shoes dry during storage.
meanings.sent2: The hygroscopicities of the salt shaker prevented the salt from clumping in the humid kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The hygroscopicities of the towel made it seem like it was magically drying itself.
meanings.sent4: The hygroscopicities of the desert sand drank up any rain that fell.
meanings.sent5: The hygroscopicities of the dehumidifier helped reduce the moisture in the room.
